intro: Toechima monticola, commonly known as the mountain toechima, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and finely divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Toechima monticola is adapted to cold, mountainous climates and is often found in alpine meadows.
